benchmark_details.name: CONFLICTS
benchmark_details.overview: CONFLICTS is a high-quality benchmark with expert annotations of conflict types in a realistic RAG setting, enabling tracking progress on how models address a wide range of knowledge conflicts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To foster research on knowledge conflict resolution in Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and provide a dataset for evaluating model performance in handling various types of knowledge conflicts.

data.source: Curated from multiple datasets including ConflictingQA, FreshQA, SituatedQA Temp, and more, encompassing a wide range of knowledge conflict scenarios.
data.annotation: Annotated by expert annotators following a three-stage review process for reliability.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on model outputs compared to expert annotations and benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Model outputs are evaluated for factual correctness, adherence to expected response behaviors based on conflict types, and overall quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance metrics vary per model evaluated on CONFLICTS, with the best models achieving over 60% adherence to expected behaviors.
methodology.validation: Conducted via a multi-faceted evaluation approach leveraging both automated and human assessments.
